definition: lit. in the same boat under wind and rain (idiom); fig. to stick together in hard times
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet
rain/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],場|场[chang2]
like/same/similar/together/alike/with
(used in given names)/variant of 同[tong2]
see 衚衕|胡同[hu2 tong4]
boat

sentences.english: What Americans do at times of tragedy is to come together and support each other.
sentences.chinese: 风雨同舟，荣辱与共是美国人民面对不幸的传统美德。

sentences.english: Lovers can undergo difficulties, but part after that.
sentences.chinese: 爱人可以风雨同舟，之后却天各一方。

sentences.english: Having gone through many years of hardship in the same boat, the old couple have a rather acute sense of the true value of love in their life.
sentences.chinese: 风雨同舟几十年，这对老夫妇深感人生中爱情的珍贵。

sentences.english: Can not find a person to accompany me to stand together through storm and stress that I walk alone.
sentences.chinese: 找不到可以陪我风雨同舟的人，那我就一个人走。

sentences.english: We look forward with you through storm and stress together to open a new world.
sentences.chinese: 我们期待与您风雨同舟，携手开创新的天地。

definition: (of friends or partners) to share both the honor and the disgrace (idiom)
cross a river in the same boat (idiom); fig. having common interests/obliged to collaborate towards common goals
shared delights and common hardships (idiom); to share life's joys and sorrows/for better or for worse
hand in hand and shoulder to shoulder
to share joys and sorrows/sharing good times and hard times/same as 同甘共苦
to walk hand in hand/to cooperate
to moisten with spittle (idiom); sharing meager resources/mutual help in humble circumstances
to stand by (sb) (idiom)/steadfast loyalty
of one mind (idiom)
love is more solid than gold (idiom)
to be kind and love one another (idiom); bound by deep emotions
to accompany sb/to accompany each other
to treat one another with absolute sincerity (idiom); to show total devotion
to go through thick and thin (idiom)
to stick together through thick and thin (idiom)
true sentiments are seen in hard times (idiom)/you see who your true friends are when you go through tough times together/you see who your true friends are when you are in difficulties
